fileDragEnter(File[], Component) - Method in interface ch.telegraphstudios.TSMenuBar.FileDrop.Listener
 
fileDragEnter(File[], Component) - Method in class ch.telegraphstudios.TSMenuBar.TSDroplet
 
fileDragExit(Component) - Method in interface ch.telegraphstudios.TSMenuBar.FileDrop.Listener
 
fileDragExit(Component) - Method in class ch.telegraphstudios.TSMenuBar.TSDroplet
 
FileDrop - Class in ch.telegraphstudios.TSMenuBar
This class makes it easy to drag and drop files from the operating system to a Java program.
FileDrop(Component, FileDrop.Listener) - Constructor for class ch.telegraphstudios.TSMenuBar.FileDrop
Constructs a FileDrop with a default light-blue border and, if c is a Container, recursively sets all elements contained within as drop targets, though only the top level container will change borders.
FileDrop(Component, boolean, FileDrop.Listener) - Constructor for class ch.telegraphstudios.TSMenuBar.FileDrop
Constructor with a default border and the option to recursively set drop targets.
FileDrop(PrintStream, Component, FileDrop.Listener) - Constructor for class ch.telegraphstudios.TSMenuBar.FileDrop
Constructor with a default border and debugging optionally turned on.
FileDrop(PrintStream, Component, boolean, FileDrop.Listener) - Constructor for class ch.telegraphstudios.TSMenuBar.FileDrop
Constructor with a default border, debugging optionally turned on and the option to recursively set drop targets.
FileDrop(Component, Border, FileDrop.Listener) - Constructor for class ch.telegraphstudios.TSMenuBar.FileDrop
Constructor with a specified border
FileDrop(Component, Border, boolean, FileDrop.Listener) - Constructor for class ch.telegraphstudios.TSMenuBar.FileDrop
Constructor with a specified border and the option to recursively set drop targets.
FileDrop(PrintStream, Component, Border, FileDrop.Listener) - Constructor for class ch.telegraphstudios.TSMenuBar.FileDrop
Constructor with a specified border and debugging optionally turned on.
FileDrop(PrintStream, Component, Border, boolean, FileDrop.Listener) - Constructor for class ch.telegraphstudios.TSMenuBar.FileDrop
Full constructor with a specified border and debugging optionally turned on.
FileDrop.Event - Class in ch.telegraphstudios.TSMenuBar
This is the event that is passed to the filesDropped(...) method in your FileDropListener when files are dropped onto a registered drop target.
FileDrop.Listener - Interface in ch.telegraphstudios.TSMenuBar
Implement this inner interface to listen for when files are dropped.
FileDrop.TransferableObject - Class in ch.telegraphstudios.TSMenuBar
At last an easy way to encapsulate your custom objects for dragging and dropping in your Java programs!
FileDrop.TransferableObject.Fetcher - Interface in ch.telegraphstudios.TSMenuBar
Instead of passing your data directly to the FileDrop.TransferableObject constructor, you may want to know exactly when your data was received in case you need to remove it from its source (or do anyting else to it).
filesDropped(File[], Component) - Method in interface ch.telegraphstudios.TSMenuBar.FileDrop.Listener
This method is called when files have been successfully dropped.
filesDropped(File[], Component) - Method in class ch.telegraphstudios.TSMenuBar.TSDroplet
 
FOREGROUND_COLOR - Static variable in class ch.telegraphstudios.TSMenuBar.Design
This is the color to use for labels, titles and other foreground elements.
